alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued May 29 at 5:32PM MDT until May 29 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northeastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 630 PM MDT. * At 531 PM MDT, a dust storm was over Farmington, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 145 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 45 and 99, and between Mile Markers 102 and 106. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Navajo Dam, NAPI Headquarters, Archuleta, Navajo Lake State Park, Turley and Cedar Hill. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
